tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids Sorry, we have no confidence in your agency or you. This disaster of a landfill site is too close to large residential areas and it's operation must stop.

@EnvAgencyMids You are stalling til 2026, fooling no one, stench is worse than ever since fresh air Friday, a massive fail from you all, hang you heads in shame, not fit for purpose organisation @AaronBell4NUL will hold you to account #stopthestink

@EnvAgencyMids BTW, three illegal waste loads per week have been turned away while the operators knew you were watching. How many hundreds more are already in the ground? Why haven't you entered Red Industries' premises to look at their records? Why no samples? Why no action?

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids Sorry, but you challenged them to reduce the pollution (stop referring to it as odour) by 30 April. The situation hasn't changed one bit. Stop challenging. Start prosecuting. Close it down. Cap it off.

@EnvAgencyMids This monitoring does not consider the impact to health in the home where wind does not clear it. Once it enters its hard to clear. Been in my house for 2 days and struggled to clear it out even with doors open (no smell outside). It IS having a short term health impact on me.

An everyday occurrence for many  residents affected within I would say about 4 miles either direction of the landfill. How is this ok??? @ClareDinnisEA is useless @EnvAgencyMids chronically useless and shameful!! No action just talking @MattHancock @BorisJohnson @MPGeorgeEustice https://t.co/r38POe61R9

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP

urls.title: Environment Agency launches educational tools for WOD to ‘help marine life thrive’ - Preventing Plastic Pollution
urls.description: Schools across England will mark World Ocean Day (WOD) next month (Tuesday, June 8) by exploring the journey of plastic with the Environment Agency. Primary and secondary schools are invited to view a series of online films and activities via an interactive map in advance of the event, culminating in a live question and answer sessio n with Environment Agency and World Wildlife Fund experts on the actual day. By clicking on different points of the map, students can learn how plastic pollution travels

tweets.text:
Ahead of #WorldOceanDay, we've developed an interactive tool for primary and secondary school students to show how plastic pollution travels to the ocean.

If you're a teacher, parent or guardian, read more here:
https://t.co/YvPDT5eR45 

@Plastic_EU #STEMEducation https://t.co/aU627GeQJx

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids Oh look another well timed PR exercise tweet directly after Aaron’s postings 🥱🥱🥱🤣 see straight through it @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA do you really think we are stupid

@AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk @JournoJess_ respiratory paediatrician at Royal Stoke confirming a rise in cases of children showing new respiratory symptoms connected to Walley’s Quarry gases! This is now the 2nd Dr to speak out!This is terrifying! #stopthestink https://t.co/WOc9ECqa58

Recently, Emma has noticed traces of diesel in the River test after it has rained. Emma is calling on the @EnvAgency and @SouthernWater to take action to stop the diesel pollution in the river. 

You can support Emma and sign her petition here: https://t.co/nATRjXOPLM

Our latest #WalleysQuarry update is now live. Read it here 👉 https://t.co/o558iAVicn

We are challenging the operator every step of the way to take action to reduce the odour levels from their operations & the impact these are having on the local community

#NewcastleUnderLyme https://t.co/eEk0VcA8fX
@EnvAgencyMids Sorry we dont believe you, your organisation is a scam !

@EnvAgencyMids This says you regulate the permits you issue through monitoring and visits. Which means you are blind to anything that happens in between. I'm very surprised that monitoring of air quality isn't a permanent feature, so that you can fully and properly discharge your duties

Cocktail of meds to help me breathe when the landfill gas https://t.co/mozaYmpBHS reg meds before the landfill https://t.co/6DeXrQZale my pocket is lighter by £32.I was a mild asthmatic adult prior to this.  Over to you @MattHancock #stopthestink @AaronBell4NUL https://t.co/mWT61fpxSQ
